column5: We set out for Lake Ontartio about 6 a.m. this morning, on the water by 7 and were greeted by this beautiful sunrise.    It was a touch nippy this morning, but I think that was only because it has been so hot and muggy the last few days our bodies weren't used to it.  That soon changed and it got very hot out there with no wind.  We set out three lines, all with dipsey divers, one with cut bait herring and a spin doctor, one with a spoon and one with a fly.  We trolled from 7 a.m. and got nothing until 11 a.m. when the cut bait herring line goes off.  My turn to grab the rod and I set the hook.  The fish did a fantastic ariel display 5 times, it was a beautiful sight.  It was a bit of a tough reel in as the dipsy wouldn't disengage, but the fish wasn't that big so I managed.  We were surprised it was not a salmon, but a steelhead.  Nice little chromer    That was it for the day and we headed back at noon.  I though this little shack looked cool at the launch.    I also caught this little bugger sunning himself on a rock, all spread eagled.  It looked pretty funny, and he wasn't too afraid of me, more annoyed I was interrupting his down time.    Cheers,  Joey
Great stuff Joey and Paul. Glad you got out on such a fine day. That fish gunna be din din?
That fish was din, din and is now digesting     BBQ'd it with some lemon, dill, onion and garlic, mmmm, mmmm.  Joey
Great report and pics Joey!!!  Those are some really nice pics!    nice fingernails too!
Looks like a fun day for you guys Joey. Love the pics. Thanks for sharing!!!
What a great way to enjoy the day, right down to the bbq!  Congratz Joey and thanks for the post and pics.  That's a beauty 'bow.
Nice going Joey!  Very nice steelie you got there!  Nice pictures as usual...the sunset was awesome and that shack was pretty cool looking as well.  Out-fished Paul again did you?? LOL.
Well nice to see a Tybo and Joey report its been awhile it looks like that house needs a shave.  MTP
WTG Joey... glad to see yous got out... Sunday sure was the better day to be on the water...  Nice pic's, thanks for sharing..
Great stuff Joey, always nice to end a good day on the water with an even better meal   Cute pic of the squirrel as well  Maureen
Nice fish.. need some more cool weather to really kick them in high gear
Attagrrl, Joey.  I like your eye with the camera there.  The other one, the one without the camera, I like too.  Ok, ok, I like em both.  Thanks for your report.
Nice report joey,!!!!!! looked like a nice day to be out on lake ontario,and you gotta love those fiesty steelhead,they always put on a show too  ...thanks for sharing nice pics too...cheers
Mmmm fresh fish with lemon and dill.  Now I'm hungry again, thanks Joey
